p: The roots of Hyptis comaroides Harley & J.F.B.Pastore (syn. Peltodon longipes A.St.-Hill ex Bentham) seem to be a source of abietane diterpenes. The species afforded the compounds horminone ( 1), inuroyleanol ( 23), sugiol ( 24), 7- α-acetoxyroyleanone ( 25), royleanone ( 26), 7-ketoroyleanone ( 27), 7 α-ethoxyroyleanone ( 28), iguestol ( 29), deoxyneocryptotanshinone ( 30), 12-hydroxy-11-methoxyabieta-8,11,13-trien-7-one ( 31), cryptojaponol ( 32) and orthosiphonol ( 33) ( Fronza et al., 2011).
